summary: Cobalt is a hard, gray metal with the symbol Co and atomic number 27. It's rarely found in nature as a pure element, but is often in ores with nickel and copper. People have used cobalt-based blue pigments for thousands of years. Today, cobalt is mainly used in batteries, strong alloys, and to color glass and ceramics. It's also important for living things as part of vitamin B12. Most cobalt comes from the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The name "cobalt" comes from a German word for "goblin ore."
title: Cobalt
